message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.IR, cs.CR 

This paper is about using Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs) for a text classification task, specifically detecting deceptive reviews. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language), which deals with natural language processing and computational linguistics. The use of GANs also suggests that it could belong to cs.LG (Machine Learning), which deals with the development of algorithms that can learn from data. Additionally, the paper involves reinforcement learning, which could place it in cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). The task of detecting deceptive reviews could also fall under cs.IR (Information Retrieval), which deals with the retrieval of relevant information from large collections of data. Finally, since the paper deals with the detection of spam, it could also belong to cs.CR (Cryptography and Security).
